009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.normL2;
014import static java.lang.Math.cos;
015import static java.lang.Math.sin;
016import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
017
018import java.util.Locale;
019
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
022import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
023
024/**
025 * Represents an algebraic ellipse with the implicit equation
026 * A x^2 + B x y + C y^2 + D x + E y + F = 0.
027 * Parameters [A, ..., F] are normalized such that B^2 - 4 A C = -1.
028 * Instances are immutable.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 */
032public class AlgebraicEllipse {
033        
034        public final double A, B, C, D, E, F;
035        
036        /**
037         * The main constructor.
038         * Creates a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance by normalizing the
039         * supplied parameters [A,...,F] such that d = B^2 - 4 A C = -1.
040         * Throws an exception if d is non-negative.
041         * 
042         * @param A parameter A
043         * @param B parameter B
044         * @param C parameter C
045         * @param D parameter D
046         * @param E parameter E
047         * @param F parameter F
048         */
049        public AlgebraicEllipse(double A, double B, double C, double D, double E, double F) {
050                double d = sqr(B) - 4 * A * C;
051                if (d > -Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE) {   // discriminant (d) must be negative!
052                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal ellipse parameters, non-negative discriminant " + d);
053                }
054                // d < 0
055                // normalize to B^2 - 4 A C = -1
056                double s = 1 / sqrt(-d);
057                if (A >= 0) {
058                        this.A = A * s;
059                        this.B = B * s;
060                        this.C = C * s;
061                        this.D = D * s;
062                        this.E = E * s;
063                        this.F = F * s;
064                }
065                else {
066                        this.A = -A * s;
067                        this.B = -B * s;
068                        this.C = -C * s;
069                        this.D = -D * s;
070                        this.E = -E * s;
071                        this.F = -F * s;
072                }
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance from the
077         * specified parameter vector [A,...,F].
078         * 
079         * @param p algebraic ellipse parameters
080         */
081        public AlgebraicEllipse(double[] p) {
082                this(p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4], p[5]);
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance from
087         * a {@link GeometricEllipse}.
088         * 
089         * @param ge a {@link GeometricEllipse}
090         */
091        public AlgebraicEllipse(GeometricEllipse ge) {
092                this(getAlgebraicEllipseParameters(ge));
093        }
094        
095        private static double[] getAlgebraicEllipseParameters(GeometricEllipse ge) {
096                double ra = ge.ra;
097                double rb = ge.rb;
098                double xc = ge.xc;
099                double yc = ge.yc;
100                double theta = ge.theta;
101                
102                double cosT = cos(theta);
103                double sinT = sin(theta);
104                
105                double A = sqr(ra * sinT) + sqr(rb * cosT);
106                double B = 2 * (sqr(rb) - sqr(ra)) * sinT * cosT;
107                double C = sqr(ra * cosT) + sqr(rb * sinT);
108                double D = -2 * A * xc - B * yc;
109                double E = -2 * C * yc - B * xc;
110                double F = A * sqr(xc) + B * xc * yc + C * sqr(yc) - sqr(ra * rb);      
111                return new double[] {A, B, C, D, E, F};
112        }
113        
114        /**
115         * Return a vector of parameters for this ellipse.
116         * The length of the vector and the meaning of the parameters depends
117         * on the concrete ellipse type.
118         * 
119         * @return a vector of parameters [A, B, C, D, E, F]
120         */
121        public double[] getParameters() {
122                return new double[] {A, B, C, D, E, F};
123        }
124        
125        public double getAlgebraicDistance(Pnt2d p) {
126                double x = p.getX();
127                double y = p.getY();
128                return A * sqr(x) + B * x * y + C * sqr(y) + D * x + E * y + F;
129        }
130        
131        public double getSampsonDistance(Pnt2d p) {
132                double x = p.getX();
133                double y = p.getY();
134                double ad = A * sqr(x) + B * x * y + C * sqr(y) + D * x + E * y + F;    // algebraic distance
135                double nGrad = Math.hypot(2*A*x + B*y + D, 2*C*y + B*x + E);
136                return ad / nGrad;
137        }
138        
139        public double getGoncharovaDistance(Pnt2d p) {
140                double x = p.getX();
141                double y = p.getY();
142                double G = A * sqr(x) + B * x * y + C * sqr(y) + D * x + E * y + F;     // algebraic distance
143                
144                double[] gV = {2*A*x + B*y + D, 2*C*y + B*x + E};
145                double ngV = normL2(gV);
146                double sd = G / ngV;
147                
148                double[][] H = {{ 2*A, B }, { B, 2*C }};
149                double gd = sd * (1 + G * Matrix.dotProduct(multiply(gV, H), gV) / (2 * Math.pow(ngV, 4)));
150                return gd;
151        }
152        
153        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
154        
155        @Override
156        public boolean equals(Object other) {
157                if (this == other) {
158                        return true;
159                }
160                if (!(other instanceof AlgebraicEllipse)) {
161            return false;
162        }
163                return this.equals((AlgebraicEllipse) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
164        }
165        
166        public boolean equals(AlgebraicEllipse other, double tolerance) {
167                return 
168                                Arithmetic.equals(A, other.A, tolerance) &&
169                                Arithmetic.equals(B, other.B, tolerance) &&
170                                Arithmetic.equals(C, other.C, tolerance) &&
171                                Arithmetic.equals(D, other.D, tolerance) &&
172                                Arithmetic.equals(E, other.E, tolerance) &&
173                                Arithmetic.equals(F, other.F, tolerance) ;
174        }
175        
176        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
177        
178        public AlgebraicEllipse duplicate() {
179                return new AlgebraicEllipse(this.getParameters());
180        }
181        
182        @Override
183        public String toString() {
184                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s %s", 
185                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), 
186                                Matrix.toString(getParameters()));
187        }
188        
189        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
190        
191//      public static void main(String[] args) {
192//              PrintPrecision.set(9);
193//              GeometricEllipse eg  = new GeometricEllipse(150, 50, 150, 150, 0.5);
194//              System.out.println("eg = " + eg);
195//              AlgebraicEllipse ea = new AlgebraicEllipse(eg);
196//              System.out.println("ea = " + ea);
197//              
198//              Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(300, 300);
199//              System.out.println("p  = " + p);
200//              Pnt2d pc = eg.getClosestPoint(p);
201//              System.out.println("pc = " + pc);
202//              
203//              System.out.println("Sampson dist(p) = " + ea.getSampsonDistance(p));
204//              System.out.println("Gonch dist(p) = " + ea.getGoncharovaDistance(p));
205//              
206//      }
207
208}
